WRITING.TITLE: Without telling us your nickname, what's the story behind your nickname?

WRITING.TEXT: I always double check that the cap on my hot water bottle is screwed on really tight. Especially if someone else has made it for me.

WRITING.TITLE: What is something you always double check?

WRITING.TEXT: May the odds be ever in your favor!
Listen to the audio I posted. At about a 1:30mins he lost it and started screaming at my partner.

No, we were already moving out of our spot when he came out to start yelling. But to give you context, here is an image from google maps, where someone is parked similar to how we were. We were even closer to the front than this car. http://imgur.com/a/Fw6cb
Unfortunately, I don't have any footage of him doing that. I only have all the audio of what happened. Some partial video towards the end.

We went to the police. Gave a statement. All good, hope something happens. After all this, I'll upload the footage/audio so you guys can have a listen. I have never seen anyone as angry as this man in my life.
Phew, thanks.
Yep, called them. Will go to the police. Just got the audio footage from the dash cam. This guy is an absolute nutter.

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone on Hudson St in Hurstville tonight around 6:30pm?
WRITING.TEXT:
We had just got in our car to drive and some huge crazy guy came and started yelling at us that we parked in his driveway (we didn't). My partner got out to talk to him Calmy to show him we weren't in his driveway and he got up in her face and started spitting at her and calling us dykes and generally trying to intimidate us. Is this even legal? Any witnesses if go to the police? He seriously looked like he was about to go mental on my partner and our car.
Edit: I have partial video because I was a bit shocked and only started recording towards the end.
Edit 2: Here is the audio from our dash cam: https://youtu.be/cpLicizayX4
Looks great! Let me know if you need a UX designer. Good luck with the launch!

WRITING.TITLE: An introverts guide to talking to your crush

WRITING.TEXT:
Yep I'm already on the site looking at your jobs. Hey, I'll apply. I can get an E3 visa.
Edit: I applied. Cheers! :)

Dear mfbridges,
Nah, I'm from Australia. John Boston was just a name I came up with while drinking a John Boston beer. But if you're offering me a chance at a job, I'll totally move to Boston. I'll leave the spiders and bring the beer for sure.
Love,
Johnboston123

I just jumped from 39 degrees C in Sydney, to -5 degrees C in Stockholm, so I noped out of there and came back.
Edit: Also, not enough spiders or scary animals. Had to come back.
You'd think so, but her background is PM Commercial buildings. Office towers etc. Not residential. I have no idea about any of it, so I assumed this too. But she tells me its different.

Yes, this is why we didn't go with that builder.
The drawings are fine, they are exactly what we want. What I mean by bundled services is things like Sydney water to check the pipes (we organised that and its all good), getting a engineer, surveyor and the stuff through the council. We did all of that, and its all good.
brb moving to Sweden.
cheers. I'll give this a go as well. Thank you!
Unfortunately, none in Sydney. Unless they take people to do remote work, I think I'm out of luck unless I decide to move to Sweden.

We did ask our architect for recommendations for builders, but they only gave us one who was available, and we didn't really like their work. To be honest, they seemed a little bit dodgy, as they weren't licensed, so we passed on that.
My partner is a Project manager in construction, so she knows what she's doing. However all her contacts are in commercial construction, not in residential, so we can't really use them.
Maybe we did make a mistake in not going with those companies that do a drawing/building combo, they seemed very expensive. But they had bundled services we didn't need, so it seemed like a waste.

Dear Spotify,
Sounds like you need another UX designer. How can I apply?
Love, subject4406

WRITING.TITLE: Can anyone recommend a builder for a medium sized house extension?
WRITING.TEXT:
My partner and I want to extend our house. We have already got the plans drawn up by an architect, we just need some builders to give us a few quotes. All the builders my partner has called said they won't do it with our own plans and we have to do get them redrawn with them (which we don't want to do).
Can anyone recommend any builders/companies they have used to do an extension on a house?
We are in south west Sydney. The extension is pretty much a rectangle added to the back of our house and its going to be a new kitchen, dining and lounge plus a deck.
Just looking for recommendations if anyone knows someone, and will go off the plans we have drawn with our architect.

WRITING.TITLE: What movie, book or TV show do you think would have been justified if the "bad guy" won in the end?

WRITING.TEXT:
Thank you. Since I'm just starting, it's early days for me, I'd like to be strict with myself because I know I can easily slide back into bad eating habits.
I'll take everyone's advice on bringing our own food. I think that's the only way to go about it. We're still socializing, but just eating something different.
I do, I just don't want to be doing it every week.
